channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @6sigma Thanks. I think something like Radio will rise again.
@AdamKinzinger Please don't circulate her tweets. You're helping a troll.
Cc alito. https://t.co/tjsiNzmffI

Somehow it Must be conveyed to the Repubs on the Supreme Court that their Roe decision, as leaked, will end the Supreme Court and throw the country into chaos. It‚Äôs hard to imagine how much death there will be. They should back off.
@JRubinBlogger @CNN heh i have the same thought every time he complains.
If a baker may not be forced to bake a cake for a same-sex wedding on the basis of religious freedom, surely a woman can‚Äôt be forced to give birth. #yes https://t.co/wdChvoHCQG
@judell @nathanwallace @steampipeio @donpark yes. i see that too.
How SQL can unify access to APIs. https://t.co/IA3ptR0i5s
There was a time back in the early-mid 00s, that I hoped the World Outline would be the future of the web. https://t.co/8jKk1aBmso
@corikesler is the new place bigger?
@judell, since we last talked i've been building apps with SQL-stored data. example -- https://t.co/SLbNZ0xvfH
@corikesler pawr cawree ‚òπÔ∏è

@judell @nathanwallace @steampipeio BTW, I tuned into this from overhearing your conversation with @donpark. I figured it was worth a look, then I posted it to my linkblog feed, and people started sending me emails about how cool it is.
@rrhoover S&P 500, because it's pretty much guaranteed to go up over time, because politicians are judged on its performance.
@judell @nathanwallace @steampipeio Okay thanks, I think I understand now. This approach can only look in a single feed, the feed is the database.
@claco or "slaves"

1/5 I think a lot of people on Twitter argue for fame. They want to be famous for having an idea first, whether or not they did have it first. I don't think I do that. I like setting precedent in software. But even there, I have a motto -- "Only steal from the best." My goal is
2/5 to find ways to work with others so that the sum is greater than the parts. I think that's the challenge of our generation and all subsequent generations. We're not dealing with climate change, for example. We're losing our minds as a country in other ways, for example the
3/5 decision the Supreme Court is contemplating. You know it's not going to work, it'll be as big a disaster as climate change, but we'll feel it right away. We can't connect enough so that the people who we've supposedly trusted for being wise to avoid jumping unnecessarily,
4/5 with no possible gain, into an abyss that will certainly lead to war. It's that big a deal. At age 67, I don't have the same goals I had at 22. I'm not trying to set the world on fire, I'm trying nudge people into working with each other, even today's 22 year-olds. We should
5/5 be giving out Nobel Prizes to people who find ways to work with others. That's the challenge for the human species, from now on, imho of course.
Some top websites collect everything you type‚Äîbefore you hit submit. https://t.co/pSrwIrPvFv
Clarence Thomas demonstrates a lack of perspective known as chutzpah. https://t.co/JgzKKugkXw
Wordle 329 4/6 ‚¨úüü©‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú ‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨úüü®‚¨ú üü©üü©‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú üü©üü©üü©üü©üü©

@spectrumfox @TaylorLorenz The only way it can happen is if one of the companies in the coalition becomes the next Facebook or TikTok, and if they stick to their commitment, which I expect they wouldn‚Äôt. The only way it can work is if the member data is stored elsewhere, from the start.

@moverted @TaylorLorenz That‚Äôs really the only way it can work. Also, I went to their site and didn‚Äôt see any information about their proposal, and I‚Äôm not cool with it only being VC backed companies, because that‚Äôs where the lock-in and lack of reciprocity comes from.
